articles.name: How can I find Quote/Order/Deal Desk details? [Internal]
articles.title: How can I find Quote/Order/Deal Desk details? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You are a member of the GFI Software team and need to find details for a Quote, Order, or Deal Desk for a specific customer/partner.

 

Resolution

Important Note: Exinda/ClearView/FaxMaker Online orders will not show up

  1. Log in to the Accounts Portal
  2. Go to Manage > Orders
  3. Click the relevant button, Orders / Quotes / Deal Desks
  4. Enter the customer/partner CID in the search box
  5. Click on the Quote/Order/Deal Desk number you are interested in for more details

articles.name: How do I find a partner's/customer's Customer ID (CID)? [Internal]
articles.title: How do I find a partner's/customer's Customer ID (CID)? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You need to locate the CID for a customer or partner.

 

Resolution

  1. Log in to the Accounts Portal
  2. Go to Manage > Accounts and search for the relevant company by using one of the following:
    • the beginning of their company name (if you do not know their exact company name as it is registered in the Accounts Portal)
    • the full email address of someone who is registered on the relevant account
    • the domain name of the company with the @ prefix (e.g. @gfi.com)
  3. In the resulting list, the CID is visible directly under the company name

articles.name: How do I orchestrate the autorenewal of all NFRs? [Internal]
articles.title: How do I orchestrate the autorenewal of all NFRs? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

It is nearing the end of the year and you need to ensure that all eligible NFRs are automatically renewed before 31 Jan.

 

Resolution

1. Eligibility Criteria

NFR eligibility is based on the following criteria:

  • ARR is >$0 = renew 12 months
  • ARR = $0 = renew 3 months

2. Download the raw data

Point to Tableau

3. Put together the list

Create a Google Sheet in GFI.Business.Operations > NFR Partners List named NFR Partners List {upcoming.year}

Note: when making date adjustments below, you are working on the upcoming year; so if it's December 2025 when you're working on this, adjust the dates to Jan-Dec 2026

  1. NFR: eligible for renewed
  2. Open the NFR Yearly Renewal List sheet > adjust the "SUB_NextBilingDate" filter to the upcoming year > download it as Crosstab - Excel
  3. Open the ARR by Reseller and ARR by Distributor sheets > adjust the "ARR Date" to end of the current year > download each as Crosstab - Excel
  4. For ARR by Reseller delete all but the first 3 columns, copy-paste the raw data into the Reseller Combo ARR sheet, in column D use the formula =IF(ISBLANK(B2), A2, B2), copy paste the values to column B and delete columns A and D. B and C will now become A and B.
  5.  

 

4. Update the FAQ

 

5. Prepare the email notification

 

6. Request the automation

Ask Srikanth if there is an easy reference or playbook that can be referenced in this request so that future requests can be easily actioned

articles.name: How can I export a list of upcoming license renewals?
articles.title: How can I export a list of upcoming license renewals?
articles.body:
Situation

You are a GFI Software partner and need to export a list of upcoming license renewals.

 

Resolution

  1. Log in to the GFI Accounts Portal
  2. Go to Manage > Licenses > filter button

    Note: if you are interested in checking for a specific partner/customer you can enter their CID in the Search box before clicking the filter button
  3. The filters menu has many options.
    • For preset upcoming renewals:
      1. Click Settings to expand the menu
      2. Upcoming Renewals > Yes
      3. From Upcoming Renewal Days select one of the preset options
      4. Apply

    • For more granular control:
      1. Click License Settings to expand the menu
      2. Set Trial and NFR to No
      3. Click License to expand the menu
        • Select Filter by Date Range to enter a specific date range e.g. 03/01/2025 - 03/31/2025
        • Select Filter by Day Range to use the sliders for a specific amount of days before and/or after today
      4. Apply
      5. Once the desired results are showing on the Licenses page click gear icon > Export License
      6. From the pop-up enter a relevant title for the exported file > manually enter an email recipient or select one from the list > Export
      7. Once the "Your LicenseExportTask - Renewals Export March 2025 request was successfully processed and is now ready." appears at the bottom of the screen, the report will be delivered shortly to the selected email address from the email sales@gfi.com
      8. Open the email and click the orange download button to download the XLSX report (you may be requested to confirm your GFI Accounts Portal login credentials)

articles.name: How do I process a new business order for Exinda or GFI ClearView? [Internal]
articles.title: How do I process a new business order for Exinda or GFI ClearView? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You have received a new business order for Exinda Network Orchestrator or GFI ClearView which needs to be manually processed.

 

Resolution

1. Mandatory Compliance Prerequisite Check

The below-listed expandable items must be referred to at all times during the ordering process. Not doing so may have serious technical, financial and legal repercussions!

 

Embargoed Countries

The countries listed here in red are embargoed countries and should not be transacted with. POs originating from any of these countries or with an IOR/UC in any of these countries should be rejected without exception.

 

EUC

Check for an EUC in the EUCs folder:

  • The EUC must exist for the Distributor and the Enduser separately (usually the Enduser is the customer but it can be an MSP if they will be the ones in possession of the instance and will be controlling it on behalf of their customer)
  • The EUC only needs to be provided once, does not expire, and is good for all future orders (including trials)
  •  
  • The name schema is: EUC companyName (CID) ISOdateSigned 
  • The company name and CID in the order should precisely match that in the EUC name

If there is no EUC in the folder, a new EUC must be requested from the Distributor (even if it is for the customer) in the order ticket's initial acknowledgement message (more details below).

If you have received a new EUC:

  • Check that the company name at the top of the EUC precisely matches the company name as it is in the order
  • Check that the name, job title, signature, and date at the bottom of the EUC have all been filled in appropriately as per What is an End-User Certificate (EUC) and how do I fill it in?
  • If anything is missing, reject the EUC and ask for it to be corrected
  • If everything is as expected, rename it to fit the name schema "EUC companyName (CID) ISOdateSigned" and upload it to the EUCs folder

 

MK Denial

This is a compliance check. If the Distributor or Enduser are discovered in a search here stop right now and escalate the order without replying to the Distributor.

  1. Log in to MK Denial
  2. Under Single Field Search, set the first field to name, and the second to any word matches
  3. In the search box enter the more unique parts of the subject's name
    • Example 1: if the company name is "Poseidon Marine Electronics", omit "Marine" and "Electronics" as those are common words likely to appear in many company names, and search for "Poseidon"
    • Example 2: if the name is "Arab Bank AGT", "AGT" is less common but may not be reliable as it is an abbreviation, so include the less common of the two remaining words, "Arab", making the final search "Arab AGT"; the search is set to any word matches so it will return all the results for both words in one search
  4. Check the results for exact or very similar matches and cross-reference using the City and Country listed in the results

If you are not sure about the results, always err on the side of caution and escalate.

 

Communications

Communication should be done with the Distributor/DSM ONLY. The Reseller and/or the Customer should never be contacted or provided with License Keys, Subscription Certificates, etc.

 

2. Receive, Check, Acknowledge

Orders are placed by Distributors directly in the Web Shop, which results in a Zendesk ticket with the subject format "Exinda - Order (A-S00######)", and a draft subscription in Zuora.

 

A. Open the ticket in Zendesk and make the following changes

  1. Copy the Enduser Company Name to the end of the ticket subject (this makes the order easily identifiable for us and the Distributor):
  2. Change the Requester to the Distributor Email:
  3. Copy the subscription number and PO number to the respective ticket fields:

B. Apply the ACK.PO.Exinda macro

This will guide you to make sure you obtain/confirm all necessary documentation/information. Run through the automatically created message "checklist" and fill it in as needed.

the value of this order is USD

  1. Click on the Zuora Draft Subscription link
    Note: if an ADXX promo code has been applied, check the order for a Deal Desk reference number under Special Instructions and check the Deal Desk to confirm it matches; if none is provided, ask the Distributor for clarification
  2. Scroll down to the bottom and click Save And Preview
  3. Select End of Term and click Refresh
  4. Scroll down, make a note of the Total and click Done
  5. Go back to the ticket and enter the amount before USD

the requested serial number(s) for renewal

  1. From the ticket info, copy the Serial Numbers
  2. Paste them after the word "renewal" (use commas if there is more than one)

the requested shaping is (currently )

  1. Go to EBS and use the Advanced Search box to find the relevant Serial Numbers
    Note: if the provided Serial Numbers look like MAC addresses, they are Host IDs
  2. Check their current shaping (integer at the end of License Name counted in M or G) and put it after "currently"
    Note: if there are multiple Serial Numbers, add the word respectively in bold after the parentheses, and put them comma separated in the same order the Serial Numbers were provided
  3. In Zuora check that the QTY for the non-zero SKUs and put the total after "is"
    Note: if there are multiple Serial Numbers you may need to combine some of the SKUs to arrive at the logical amounts, then put the comma separated in the same order the Serial Numbers were provided; if they do not add up, ask the Distributor for clarification

the term length is

Usually this is 12/24/36 months and is specified in Zuora under Initial Term. Anything outside of these 3 options can be processed but only with a valid commercial reason. If the reason is not valid, escalate for approval.

the current expiry is so the renewed expiry will be

  1. In EBS, check the License Expiry (v5+) and add it after "is" in ISO date format (YYYY-MM-DD)
    Note: if there are multiple licenses they must all have the same expiry date otherwise they cannot be on the same subscription and a separate order will have to be placed
  2. Add the Initial Term from Zuora to the License Expiry (v5+) from EBS and put the result after "be" in ISO date format (YYYY-MM-DD)

the new EUC

Depending on the results from the preliminary EUC check above, edit this message a needed. If both EUCs exist, remember to also remove the EUC attachment.

 

Important Note: if there are any discrepancies or clarification is needed on any points, only the Distributor is to be contacted, never the Reseller or the Enduser.

 

C. Send the updated message

  1. In Zendesk, if you have successfully checked/actioned EUC and MK Denial, check the EUC Checked and MK Denial Checked boxes
  2. Click Submit as On-hold to send the completed message and place the ticket On-hold
  3. Wait for the confirmation/EUC(s) as needed before proceeding to the next section
  4. If the ticket automatically opens due to the On-hold expiring, be sure to send a follow-up reminder

 

3. License, Subscription, Invoice

Once you have received the EUCs and positive confirmation on all the data from the acknowledgement message proceed with the following steps.

 

A. Update the License in EBS

Note: Acceleration (step 2) and Edge Cache (License Options (v5+)) are provided for free

  1. Log in to EBS
  2. Products >
    • Add Existing Hardware (if it's for a new physical hardware box) > Select Hardware Type and enter Serial number > Add
    • Add Virtual Hardware (if it's for a virtual instance) > Add
  3. Enter the Host ID (v5+) as provided by the customer
  4. Enter the Base License and License Increments as necessary
  5. Check the SSL Acceleration (only available from ExOS 5.5.0) box
  6. Check the Monitor Only box for GFI ClearView ONLY
  7. Enter the expiry next to License Expiry (v5+)
  8. Add the End User, Reseller, and Distributor as needed or if they are not listed, follow How do I add/edit a contact in EBS?
    Note: If the contact you search for has multiple entries choose the one with the asterisk; for Distributors choose the general contact if there is one
  9. Set the Status to Sold → Customer owned

  10. Click Update

  11. If the Expiry date (PS) is not 0000-00-00, click the Edit link, set it to 0000-00-00, and click Modify
  12. Next to Expiry date (SS) click the Edit link and set the date to the same as License Expiry (v5+) above
  13. If SDP/EMC is requested, set the Expiry date (SDP) and then send the following Side Conversation for it to be added:
    • Subject: New SDP/EMC Tenant Request
    • To: jozef.kacala@gfi.com

    • Body:
      Hi Jozef,
      Kindly assist with the EMC registration of Serial Number(s): serial_numbers
      Tenant: company_name (CID: cid_number)

  14. Next to Add comment write Subscription: sub_number, PO: po_number and click enter

  15. Next to Expiry date (SS), click the View Certificate link to download the certificate PDF

  16.

articles.name: How can I edit the custom domain(s) on a GFI HelpDesk license? [Internal]
articles.title: How can I edit the custom domain(s) on a GFI HelpDesk license? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You have been contacted by a customer to add or edit a custom domain on their GFI HelpDesk license

 

Resolution

  1. On the left side menu, click on Subscriptions and under the relevant GFI HelpDesk/Unlimited/NFR subscription click ellipses > Details
  2. On the Overview page that opens, Licenses tab > ellipses > Details
  3. On the Overview page that opens, Metadata tab > Edit
    • Note: for some subscriptions the domains may not exist and the requester may have been unable to action the How can I generate my GFI HelpDesk key file using my custom domain? instructions: Add metadata > Domains
  4. Add/edit the domain(s) as needed (comma separated if more than one) > Save 
  5. Overview tab > Generate Download Url
  6. Once the Generate Download Url link changes to Download click it to download the key.php file and share it with the requester

articles.name: How can I generate my GFI HelpDesk key file using my custom domain?
articles.title: How can I generate my GFI HelpDesk key file using my custom domain?
articles.body:
Situation

You have a GFI HelpDesk, GFI Unlimited or partner NFR subscription and need to create a GFI HelpDesk key file using your custom domain.

 

Resolution

Important Note: these instructions are only applicable to the initial key file generation. If your domain has changed and you need to regenerate your key file, contact Customer Care.

  1. Log in to the GFI Accounts Portal
  2. On the left side menu, click on Subscriptions and under the relevant GFI HelpDesk/Unlimited/NFR subscription click ellipses > Details
  3. On the Overview page that opens, scroll down (if applicable) to locate GFI HelpDesk, click Generate and in the pop-up click Next
  4. In the Configuration pop-up, enter up to 2 comma separated, custom domains in the GFI HelpDesk Domains field and click Generate

    Note: localhost is already added by default
  5. On the License summary pop-up click the Generate Download Url link
  6. Once it becomes available, click the Download link to download the key.php file

articles.name: How to Check FMO Package, Balance, and Subscription Dates [Internal]
articles.title: How to Check FMO Package, Balance, and Subscription Dates [Internal]
articles.body:
If you need to extract bundle details, current balance, total balance, subscription date, or expiry date for FaxMaker Online (FMO), follow these updated steps:

  1. Log in to FMO
    Use your admin account to access FaxMaker Online.
  2. Access the Customer Account
    • Click on Department in the main menu.
    • Search for the customer whose details you need to access.
    • Once found, click on the gear icon in the top-right corner of the customer's page and select Login as the selected Company.
  3. View Subscription Details
    • After logging in as the customer, navigate to the Subscriptions section from the top-right dropdown menu.
    • Select Renew or Modify My Plan to view bundle details, current balance, total balance, subscription dates, and expiry dates.

articles.name: Embargo & Supp 3 Countries [Internal]
articles.title: Embargo & Supp 3 Countries [Internal]
articles.body:
Embargo Countries

Any POs originating from or directed to any of these countries must be rejected!

  • Belarus
  • Cuba
  • Iran
  • Libya
  • North Korea
  • Russia
  • Somalia
  • Sudan
  • Syria
  • Venezuela

Supp 3 Countries

Any government entity outside the Supplement No. 3 to Part 740—License Exception ENC Favorable Treatment Countries-listed countries (as below) needs confirmation of CCATS filings and licenses. Any such entity that refuses or questions the EUC should be reported to the compliance team as a potential red flag.

The Gov end users Classification document with certain exceptions to non-Supp 3 government entities (as listed below)

When in doubt, always ask BizOps.

Austria

Australia

Belgium

Bulgaria

Canada

Croatia

Cyprus

Czech Republic

Estonia

Denmark

Finland

France

Germany

Greece

Hungary

Iceland

Ireland

Italy

Japan

Latvia

Lithuania

Luxembourg

Malta

Netherlands

New Zealand

Norway

Poland

Portugal

Romania

Slovakia

Slovenia

Spain

Sweden

Switzerland

Turkey

United Kingdom

articles.name: How do I process a renewal order for Exinda or GFI ClearView? [Internal]
articles.title: How do I process a renewal order for Exinda or GFI ClearView? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You have received a renewal order for Exinda Network Orchestrator or GFI ClearView which needs to be manually processed.

 

Resolution

1. Mandatory Compliance Prerequisite Check

The below-listed expandable items must be referred to at all times during the ordering process. Not doing so may have serious technical, financial and legal repercussions!

 

Embargoed Countries

The countries listed here in red are embargoed countries and should not be transacted with. POs originating from any of these countries or with an IOR/UC in any of these countries should be rejected without exception.

 

EUC

Check for an EUC in the EUCs folder:

  • The EUC must exist for the Distributor and the Enduser separately (usually the Enduser is the customer but it can be an MSP if they will be the ones in possession of the instance and will be controlling it on behalf of their customer)
  • The EUC only needs to be provided once, does not expire, and is good for all future orders (including trials)
  •  
  • The name schema is: EUC companyName (CID) ISOdateSigned 
  • The company name and CID in the order should precisely match that in the EUC name

If there is no EUC in the folder, a new EUC must be requested from the Distributor (even if it is for the customer) in the order ticket's initial acknowledgement message (more details below).

If you have received a new EUC:

  • Check that the company name at the top of the EUC precisely matches the company name as it is in the order
  • Check that the name, job title, signature, and date at the bottom of the EUC have all been filled in appropriately as per What is an End-User Certificate (EUC) and how do I fill it in?
  • If anything is missing, reject the EUC and ask for it to be corrected
  • If everything is as expected, rename it to fit the name schema "EUC companyName (CID) ISOdateSigned" and upload it to the EUCs folder

 

MK Denial

This is a compliance check. If the Distributor or Enduser are discovered in a search here stop right now and escalate the order without replying to the Distributor.

  1. Log in to MK Denial
  2. Under Single Field Search, set the first field to name, and the second to any word matches
  3. In the search box enter the more unique parts of the subject's name
    • Example 1: if the company name is "Poseidon Marine Electronics", omit "Marine" and "Electronics" as those are common words likely to appear in many company names, and search for "Poseidon"
    • Example 2: if the name is "Arab Bank AGT", "AGT" is less common but may not be reliable as it is an abbreviation, so include the less common of the two remaining words, "Arab", making the final search "Arab AGT"; the search is set to any word matches so it will return all the results for both words in one search
  4. Check the results for exact or very similar matches and cross-reference using the City and Country listed in the results

If you are not sure about the results, always err on the side of caution and escalate.

 

Communications

Communication should be done with the Distributor/DSM ONLY. The Reseller and/or the Customer should never be contacted or provided with License Keys, Subscription Certificates, etc.

 

2. Receipt, Check, Acknowledge

Orders are placed by Distributors directly in the Web Shop, which results in a Zendesk ticket with the subject format "Exinda - Order (A-S00######)", and a draft subscription in Zuora.

 

A. Open the ticket in Zendesk and make the following changes

  1. Copy the Enduser Company Name to the end of the ticket subject (this makes the order easily identifiable for us and the Distributor):
  2. Change the Requester to the Distributor Email:
  3. Copy the subscription number and PO number to the respective ticket fields:

B. Apply the ACK.PO.Exinda macro

This will guide you to make sure you obtain/confirm all necessary documentation/information. Run through the automatically created message "checklist" and fill it in as needed.

the value of this order is USD

  1. Click on the Zuora Draft Subscription link
    Note: if an ADXX promo code has been applied, check the order for a Deal Desk reference number under Special Instructions and check the Deal Desk to confirm it matches; if none is provided, ask the Distributor for clarification
  2. Scroll down to the bottom and click Save And Preview
  3. Select End of Term and click Refresh
  4. Scroll down, make a note of the Total and click Done
  5. Go back to the ticket and enter the amount before USD

the requested serial number(s) for renewal

  1. From the ticket info, copy the Serial Numbers
  2. Paste them after the word "renewal" (use commas if there is more than one)

the requested shaping is (currently )

  1. Go to EBS and use the Advanced Search box to find the relevant Serial Numbers
    Note: if the provided Serial Numbers look like MAC addresses, they are Host IDs
  2. Check their current shaping (integer at the end of License Name counted in M or G) and put it after "currently"
    Note: if there are multiple Serial Numbers, add the word respectively in bold after the parentheses, and put them comma separated in the same order the Serial Numbers were provided
  3. In Zuora check that the QTY for the non-zero SKUs and put the total after "is"
    Note: if there are multiple Serial Numbers you may need to combine some of the SKUs to arrive at the logical amounts, then put the comma separated in the same order the Serial Numbers were provided; if they do not add up, ask the Distributor for clarification

the term length is

Usually this is 12/24/36 months and is specified in Zuora under Initial Term. Anything outside of these 3 options can be processed but only with a valid commercial reason. If the reason is not valid, escalate for approval.

the current expiry is so the renewed expiry will be

  1. In EBS, check the License Expiry (v5+) and add it after "is" in ISO date format (YYYY-MM-DD)
    Note: if there are multiple licenses they must all have the same expiry date otherwise they cannot be on the same subscription and a separate order will have to be placed
  2. Add the Initial Term from Zuora to the License Expiry (v5+) from EBS and put the result after "be" in ISO date format (YYYY-MM-DD)

the new EUC

Depending on the results from the preliminary EUC check above, edit this message a needed. If both EUCs exist, remember to also remove the EUC attachment.

 

Important Note: if there are any discrepancies or clarification is needed on any points, only the Distributor is to be contacted, never the Reseller or the Enduser.

 

C. Send the updated message

  1. In Zendesk, if you have successfully checked/actioned EUC and MK Denial, check the EUC Checked and MK Denial Checked boxes
  2. Click Submit as On-hold to send the completed message and place the ticket On-hold
  3. Wait for the confirmation/EUC(s) as needed before proceeding to the next section
  4. If the ticket automatically opens due to the On-hold expiring, be sure to send a follow-up reminder

 

3. License, Subscription, Invoice

Once you have received the EUCs and positive confirmation on all the data from the acknowledgement message proceed with the following steps.

 

A. Update the License in EBS

Note: Acceleration (step 2) and Edge Cache (License Options (v5+)) are provided for free

  1. Find the license(s) in EBS
  2. If applicable, modify the Shaping/Acceleration using the Base License and License Increments as necessary
  3. Enter the updated expiry net to License Expiry (v5+)
  4. Add/Edit the End User, Reseller, and Distributor as needed or if they are not listed, follow How do I add/edit a contact in EBS?
    Note: If the contact you search for has multiple entries choose the one with the asterisk; for Distributors choose the general contact if there is one
  5. Set the Status to Sold → Customer owned

  6. Click Update

  7. If the Expiry date (PS) is not 0000-00-00, click the Edit link, set it to 0000-00-00, and click Modify
  8. Next to Expiry date (SS) click the Edit link and set the date to the same as License Expiry (v5+) above
  9. If SDP/EMC is requested, set the Expiry date (SDP) and then send the following Side Conversation for it to be added:
    • Subject: New SDP/EMC Tenant Request
    • To: jozef.kacala@gfi.com

    • Body:
      Hi Jozef,
      Kindly assist with the EMC registration of Serial Number(s): serial_numbers
      Tenant: company_name (CID: cid_number)

  10. Next to Add comment write Subscription: sub_number, PO: po_number and click enter

  11. Next to Expiry date (SS), click the View Certificate link to download the certificate PDF

  12.

articles.name: How can I temporarily extend an expiring/expired GFI product license? [Internal]
articles.title: How can I temporarily extend an expiring/expired GFI product license? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You have a GFI product that is close to expiry or has expired and you need to extend it temporarily while it is renewed.

Important Note: 7-day license extensions are preapproved to facilitate the renewal process and nothing else. Any situation other than that requires escalation for approval.

Note: These instructions are for all GFI products excluding ClearView, Exinda, FMO, and Kerio.

Resolution

GFI Products

  1. Log in to the Accounts Portal
  2. Go to Manage > Licenses > enter the license into the search box > ellipses > Details
  3. On the page that opens go to the Metadata and click the Edit button
  4. Scroll down to locate the Expiry date field, click on it to adjust the date, and click Save
  5. In the confirmation pop-up, verify the changes in red, enter a reason for the change in the notes (usually a Zendesk ticket number), and click Save
  6. Once the update is complete you will see a green confirmation pop-up in the bottom right and the Overview tab will automatically load showing the new End Date and Product Key

Kerio Products

  1. Log in to KISS, find the license using the search box next to License numbers and licenses

  2. Change license settings
  3. Make changes as needed > Continue
  4. Check > Save
  5. Click Activate once and wait for the page to reload
  6. After reload > License file download > share the key file and the license key with the requester

articles.name: How can I find information about an Exinda/ClearView subscription or license? [Internal]
articles.title: How can I find information about an Exinda/ClearView subscription or license? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You need to find out detailed information about an Exinda or ClearView subscription or license and there is no information on the Accounts Portal.

Note: the Accounts Portal should not be referenced for Exinda or ClearView; even if it has information, it may be lacking/unreliable.

 

Resolution

Subscription info

  1. Log in to Zuora using your Zuora OneID
    Note: if you are not redirected to the web app, click on My Apps > PROD
  2. Once in the Billing web app, enter the Subscription number or PO number in the search box (top left), wait for it to show the results in the dropdown, and click on the listed subscription
  3. Scroll through the subscription info, paying close attention to the RATE PLAN and the lines listed under it with a non-null quantity
  4. Towards the bottom of the page, you will find the Associated Events where the Invoices are listed; you can click on the invoice number link to open the invoice page
  5. On the invoice page, you can click the View Invoice PDF button to download the invoice as a PDF; this is the format it is provided to the partner

Finding License info from the Subscription

  1. On the subscription page, under the RATE PLAN refer to the line that has a non-null quantity
  2. Under the description, the relevant serial numbers(s) will be listed, starting with SN: and followed by the subscription term length in parentheses 

License info

  1. Log in to EBS
  2. Under the Advanced Search area (bottom left), enter the serial number or host ID in the relevant field and click Find
  3. Scroll through the license page to find the Model, Acceleration, Shaping, Expiry, License Key, End User, Reseller, Distributor, and download the certificate PDF (View Certificate)

Finding Subscription info from the License

  1. At the bottom of the license page is the Notes section which serves as a log to all the changes made and to which comments can be added
  2. The uppermost comment should be the most recent Subscription number and PO number or a reference to why the latest changes were made

articles.name: Zuora Notifications
articles.title: Zuora Notifications

articles.name: How can I find my customer's GFI product trial key?
articles.title: How can I find my customer's GFI product trial key?
articles.body:
Situation

You need to retrieve your customer's GFI product trial key.

 

Action

Note: If you are a customer (enduser) or partner looking for your own trial key, you can follow the instructions in How can I find my GFI product trial key?

  1. Log in to the Accounts Portal
  2. On the side menu, click Manage > Licenses tab and use the customer email, ID number or subscription number to search
  3. From the listed results, the license key is located directly under the product name with the word (Trial) in orange next to it. Keep in mind:
    • Trial keys always have the word (Trial) in orange next to the listed product name
    • If you used a company identifier (name, email, customer ID) to search, the results will show all keys from all trials and subscriptions so if there is more than one trial key for the same product you can use the PURCHASE column to discern the most recent one

Note: trial keys can only be used once per customer. Even if the trial was a long time ago the customer may still be unable to use a new trial key. In cases like this please submit a request to our Customer Care team for further assistance.

articles.name: How can I find my customer's GFI product license key?
articles.title: How can I find my customer's GFI product license key?
articles.body:
Situation

You need to retrieve your customer's GFI product license key.

 

Action

Note: If you are a customer (enduser) or partner looking for your own license key, you can follow the instructions in How can I find my GFI product license key?

  1. Log in to the Accounts Portal
  2. On the side menu, click Manage > Licenses tab and use the customer email, ID number or subscription number to search
  3. From the listed results, the license key is located directly under the product name. Keep in mind:
    • If you used a company identifier (name, email, customer ID) to search, the results will show all keys from all subscriptions so you can use the SEAT and/or EXPIRES columns to discern the relevant one
    • If you search using the subscription number, only the one valid license belonging to that subscription will appear in the results (unless it is an Unlimited subscription where all generated product licenses will show)

articles.name: What is the Network and Information Security 2 (NIS2) Directive and how can GFI Software help my clients?
articles.title: What is the Network and Information Security 2 (NIS2) Directive and how can GFI Software help my clients?
articles.body:
Situation

On 17 October 2024 the new EU cybersecurity law, Network and Information Security 2 (NIS2) Directive came into effect. All EU companies are now required to have stronger security measures for their IT infrastructure. With failure to comply resulting in fines of up to €10 million and potential prison time for executives, your clients need your help to avoid these risks and make their systems NIS2-compliant.

 

Resolution

GFI Software's solutions can help your clients make their systems NIS2-compliant.

GFI LanGuard

  • Automates vulnerability assessments and patch management
  • NEW: WAN agent support for remote workforce security

GFI ClearView

  • Provides comprehensive network monitoring and deep visibility
  • Offers proactive recommendations for network optimization

Let us help

For a little help from us as we navigate these changes together, use code NIS-2 for a 15% discount on new orders of GFI LanGuard and GFI ClearView until 30 April 2024.*

Want to learn more?

If you want to learn more about how we can tackle NIS2 together, schedule a call with our Sales Engineering team.

*Subject to change.

articles.name: How do I download my training certificate?
articles.title: How do I download my training certificate?
articles.body:
Situation

You recently passed a training exam but did not receive your training certificate as expected.

Resolution

There is no way to download your training certificate at this time. If it was not automatically sent to you, please take a moment to submit a request to our Customer Care team so they can send it to you.

articles.name: How do I submit a Deal Registration form?
articles.title: How do I submit a Deal Registration form?
articles.body:
Situation

You have a new deal and want to submit a Deal Registration from (not a Deal Desk).

Resolution

Important Note: This is not for Deal Desks. If you are interested in a Deal Desk, refer to How do I submit/check a Deal Desk for a GFI Software product in the GFI Accounts Portal?

Note: This form is for Distributor accounts only

  1. Make sure you are logged in to the Partner Portal
  2. Open the Deal Registration Form
  3. Fill in the form paying attention to all the mandatory fields
  4. Click Submit

articles.name: How can I download my order invoice?
articles.title: How can I download my order invoice?
articles.body:
Situation

You successfully placed an order and have not received the relevant invoice or received it and deleted it by accident.

Resolution

  1. Log in to the GFI Accounts Portal
  2. Go to Manage > Orders > search box > enter the PO number of the relevant order
  3. Click on the listed result
  4. On the Order Details page that opens, click the blue download arrow next to the invoice number on the right-hand side

articles.name: What is the GFI LanGuard WAN Agent feature and how do I set it up?
articles.title: What is the GFI LanGuard WAN Agent feature and how do I set it up?
articles.body:
Overview

You've heard about the GFI LanGuard WAN Agent feature and would like to know more and try it out.

 

Details

What is the WAN Agent?

How does it work?

How do I set it up and use it?

WAN Agent communication protocols

WAN Agent scan timeout FAQs

 

What is the WAN Agent?

The WAN agent is a new feature that helps address the need of customers to scan remote users without the need to use a VPN. The WAN agent empowers customers to identify and address vulnerabilities across distributed infrastructures from a centralized interface. With its lightweight design and minimal footprint, the WAN Agent ensures minimal resource consumption, granting you the freedom to optimize your vulnerability assessment and patch management strategy.

 

How does it work?

The WAN agent is installed in each remote computer that needs to be remotely scanned and patched using the GFI LanGuard console.

The WAN agent and the GFI LanGuard console will communicate securely using AWS to send/receive the commands for scanning and patching. The ports used by the WAN Agent are 443, 8443, and 8883.

 

How do I set it up and use it?

Prerequisites

  • The installers and files referenced in the instructions below (including a PDF copy of this guide) can be downloaded from the prerequisite files folder.
  • Submit a WAN Agent request with our Customer Care team to be provided with the following:
    • Certificate ID
    • Tenant ID
    • LanGuard server WAN name
    • Provisioning claim certificate
    • Private Key for certificate
    • LanGuard server certificate
    • LanGuard server private key
  • Outbound communication must be allowed from ports 443, 8443, and 8883 on the target machines where the WAN Agent is installed

Important: this process will require a reboot of both the GFI LanGuard host and the remote machine(s) where the agent(s) will be installed.

 

Enabling on the main install

  1. Download and install the Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable
    Note: if the installer says the required version is already installed, this step can be skipped
  2. Install or Upgrade GFI LanGuard to the latest version supporting the WAN feature
  3. Unblock tls12.ps1 and run it in Powershell in administrator mode
    Note: If you get an error message stating that the script cannot be loaded because script execution is disabled, run the following command: Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope Process -ExecutionPolicy Bypass 
  4. Reboot the system
  5. Open the GFI LanGuard console, and go to Configuration > Agents management >
    WAN Agents settings
  6. In the input fields, add the data and files provided previously by the Customer Care team
    Optional:
    • configure the WAN Agent offline timeout (in hours) to define how long after a WAN Agent goes offline it is considered inactive and removes itself from the target computer ("offline" is defined as no communication between the WAN Agent and the GFI LanGuard console e.g. due to connectivity or being decommissioned)
    • limit the bandwidth the WAN agents take when downloading patches by checking Enable download bandwidth limit and setting the desired MB/sec
  7. Click Generate WAN Agent Installer to generate the WAN Agent installer MSI file, making a note of the location of the generated files
    Note: It takes a moment to generate the MSI installer file
  8. Click Apply

Installing on the remote machine

  1. Download and install the Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable
    Note: if the installer says the required version is already installed, this step can be skipped
  2. Unblock tls12.ps1 and run it in Powershell in administrator mode
    Note: If you get an error message stating that the script cannot be loaded because script execution is disabled, run the following command: Set-ExecutionPolicy -Scope Process -ExecutionPolicy Bypass 
  3. Reboot the system
  4. To uninstall any previous installations, run MsiExec.exe /X{160301DE-306A-4ADE-8A47-BC5790AF0486}
  5. Download LanGuardWANAgent.msi to the remote machine (generated via step 4 of Enabling on the main install) > right-click > Run as administrator
  6. Once the installation is completed, a new node for this agent with the machine’s name as the target will show up under Remote Devices in the computer tree of the GFI LanGuard server dashboard

Important: once the installation is completed, verify that the attendant service is running (especially if you did not install as admin). Run services.msc in the command prompt > search for the service GFI LanGuard 12 Attendant Service > if it is not running, right-click > Start.

 

Scan and monitor

  1. Select the newly added machine > right-click > Scan > Custom Scan
    Note: alternatively, you can select a group of computers that have the WAN Agent deployed
  2. Choose the desired scanning profile
  3. Click Scan
    Note:     the scan will start but there will be no input on the console as the scan is running directly on the remote machine
  4. To monitor the scan operation, go to Activity Monitor > Security Scans

 

WAN Agent communication protocols

For the WAN Agent feature, messages are exchanged between the WAN Agents and the GFI LanGuard console. These messages are classified into several distinct categories.

1XX (Agent to Server)
These are specific, targeted messages initiated by the agent to communicate its status, perform actions like changing network modes (WAN/LAN), initiate scans, or send updates. Examples include:

  • AgentInstalled (100): Notifies the server that an agent has been installed.

  • AgentSwitchToWAN (101): Informs the server that the agent is switching to WAN mode.

  • AgentScanStart (110): The agent informs the server that it has started a scan.

2XX (Broadcast by Agent)
Broadcast messages initiated by agents.

3XX (Agent Acknowledgements)
These are acknowledgement (ACK) messages sent by agents to confirm receipt or successful execution of requests initiated by the server. For example:

  • AgentScanRequest_ACK (300): Acknowledges the server's scan request.

  • AgentUpdateRequest_ACK (303): Acknowledges the server’s request to update the agent.

4XX (Agent Error Messages)
These messages indicate errors that occurred during actions initiated by the agent. Examples include:

  • AgentDeployPatchAgentRequest_ERR (401): Indicates an error occurred while the agent was trying to deploy a patch.

  • AgentUpdateRequest_ERR (403): Signals an issue with the agent update process.

5XX (Server to Agent Requests)
These are direct messages from the server to the agent, requesting specific actions. For example:

  • ServerRequestScan (500): Requests that the agent start a scan.

  • ServerRequestDeployPatchAgent (501): Requests the agent to deploy a patch.

6XX (Broadcast by Server)
These would be broadcast messages initiated by the server.

7XX (Server Acknowledgements)
These are acknowledgement messages sent by the server in response to agent actions. For example:

  • ServerAgentInstalled_ACK (700): Confirms that the server acknowledges the agent installation.

  • ServerScanStart_ACK (710): Acknowledges the agent's notification of scan start.

8XX (Server Error Messages)
These messages indicate errors that occurred during server-initiated actions or in response to agent actions. For instance:

  • ServerAgentInstalled_ERR (800): Indicates an issue with the server's handling of an agent installation.

  • ServerScanFinished_ERR (812): Indicates an error occurred when the scan finished.

In summary, the system facilitates a structured communication protocol where the WAN agents report status, perform actions, and respond to GFI LanGuard server requests. The GFI LanGuard servers can issue commands to agents, which are acknowledged or may trigger error responses based on success or failure.

 

WAN Agent scan timeout FAQs

How does the counter for the WAN agent offline timeout function?
The WAN agent scan timeout setting controls how long remote network scans can run before timing out. This setting is managed centrally on the LanGuard server and ensures that WAN agent scans don’t run indefinitely by enforcing a maximum duration limit.

After the timeout, does the absence of connection continue?
Once the timeout expires, the LanGuard server cancels its tracking of the scan job. However, the WAN agent continues scanning independently. If the scan completes, the WAN agent will send the results back to the server, which will process and update them despite having canceled the job.

After a timeout, when and how is the agent restarted?
The scan timeout only affects job tracking on the server side, not the WAN agent. The WAN agent continues running normally and will not restart due to this timeout.

Who is counting the time? The Agent, Relay, or Server?
The LanGuard server tracks and enforces the timeout, maintaining the timer for how long each WAN agent scan runs.

Who decides when the time is fulfilled? The Server, Agent, or Relay?
The LanGuard server decides and controls the timeout period for each WAN agent scan job.

articles.name: Why can't I access the GFI Software Partner Portal?
articles.title: Why can't I access the GFI Software Partner Portal?
articles.body:
Situation

You are trying to access the GFI Software Partner Portal but are landing on a page that says you are already logged in or on a login page that says you have the wrong credentials.

Resolution

Important Note: the GFI Software Partner Portal is only accessible using a partner tier account (Reseller or Distributor). Enduser accounts do not have access to the GFI Software Partner Portal.

Make sure you are using the most recent Partner Portal address gfi.ai/partners/partner-portal (i.e. not the old address partners.gfi.com).

If you are still facing issues despite using the latest address, submit a request to our Customer Care team.

articles.name: How can I download an existing/generate a new subscription certificate?
articles.title: How can I download an existing/generate a new subscription certificate?
articles.body:
Situation

You need to download an existing subscription certificate or, following a mid-term modification, generate a new one.

Resolution

Note: this can be actioned only by Partner accounts that have visibility of the relevant subscription

 

To get started

  1. Log in to the Accounts Portal and go to Manage > Subscriptions,
  2. Enter a valid subscription number in the search box
  3. On the relevant subscription listing click ellipses > View Details
    • Alternative: if the customer's subscription number is not known, go to Manage > Accounts, enter the customer's company name or Customer ID (CID) in the search box, on the relevant listing click ellipses > View Subscriptions

      then on the page that opens on the relevant subscription listing click ellipses > Details

 

To download a current subscription certificate

  1. On the subscription details page, click gear icon > View Subscription Certificates
  2. On the pop-up dialogue, click ellipses on the most recent listing > Download to start the automatic download

 

To generate and download a new subscription certificate

  1. On the subscription details page, click gear icon > Generate Subscription Certificate
  2. Wait for the confirmation dialogue to appear and click Download to start the automatic download

articles.name: What are General Guidelines for Placing EtherFax Orders?
articles.title: What are General Guidelines for Placing EtherFax Orders?
articles.body:
Please follow these guidelines when placing any EtherFax order:

  1. New Accounts: Must contain the Account Activation SKU and one DID in the order.

  2. Renewal Orders: Place renewal orders for annual EtherFax accounts only. Monthly accounts cannot be directly converted to annual accounts.

  3. Monthly to Annual Account Conversion: If a customer wishes to move from a monthly to an annual account create a customer care ticket informing about the move. Wait for the Customer Care team to create a new annual account. Once created, place a new order ensuring it includes the Account Activation SKU and one DID.

  4. Assigned DIDs: All orders must include renewal for ALL Assigned DIDs. This requirement applies regardless of Ports status. If the customer wants to renew fewer DIDs, they would need to specify the list of DIDs they want to retain and the rest will be deleted.

  5. Proration for DIDs: Proration for DIDs needs to be applied manually by the Customer Care team when necessary. Create a customer care ticket to inform about the proration. Wait for acknowledgement from the customer care team before placing the order.

  6. Special Discounts: Apply special discounts to the order only after obtaining necessary approval. Create a customer care ticket detailing the special discount and include proof of approval. Place the order only after receiving acknowledgement from the Customer Care team.

For any questions or special circumstances not covered by these guidelines, please contact the Customer Care team for assistance.

articles.name: How do I submit/check a Deal Desk for Exinda or GFI ClearView in the GFI Accounts Portal?
articles.title: How do I submit/check a Deal Desk for Exinda or GFI ClearView in the GFI Accounts Portal?
articles.body:
Situation

There are special circumstances for an upcoming deal and you need to request a discount.

 

Action

Note: This feature is only available for certain Partner accounts and is submitted via the GFI Accounts Portal (not the GFI Partner Portal)

EUC: If you have not provided us with the new EUC for the relevant Enduser, please make sure to submit it as soon as possible to avoid delays during the ordering process. Click here for more details and to download the latest blank EUC.

  1. Log in to the Accounts Portal and follow the regular Exinda/GFI ClearView order process for your order
    Note: in step 3 make sure to change the Contract Effective Date to the current date of expiry because that is the date the license will be renewed from
  2. Instead of completing the order in step 4, enter the requested discount amount in the Discount box and click Submit Deal Desk
    • Note: if you make changes in step 4 (for example, the quantity of one of the items), click the Preview Order button for the values to be updated and the Submit Deal Desk button will reappear.
    • Note: if you click any of the other buttons you will be met with the error "Discount can only be applied for Deal Desks". If you are trying to apply a preapproved promo code, please enter it in the  Promo Codes field instead.
  3. In the dialogue box that appears, provide a detailed but concise description of the circumstances or reasons for the discount being requested; before clicking Confirm check the guidelines below

    Enhancing Your Deal Desk Submission: To help expedite your Deal Desk submission and increase its chances of approval, make sure to address the below:

    • Clarity and Relevance: Are the reasons for the discount clearly explained and directly tied to the success of the deal?
    • Market and Competition: Does the request consider current market conditions or competitive factors that support the discount?
    • Customer Value: Is there a clear explanation of the value the deal offers to the customer and to GFI Software?
    • Strategic Fit: Does the reasoning align with GFI Software's strategic goals and provide a demonstrable effort by the partner to contribute to the discount?
    • Risk and Mitigation: Are potential risks addressed, and are there strategies to mitigate them?
  4. On the confirmation dialogue that appears click the Go to Deal Desk button to open the detailed Deal Desk page
    • Note: the confirmation dialogue includes the unique Deal Desk number starting with "DD-202"
    • Note: the Place Another Deal Desk button can be used to immediately submit another request (all submitted deal desks can be found by following the instructions in the note at the end of this article)
  5. On the page that opens you will see the details of your request and the status of your request; initially, this will be yellow, pending approval:
  6. Once examined, you will receive a notification that the deal desk has either been:
    • Approved: the request was well-supported, aligns with strategic goals, and makes a strong case so the discounted order can now be placed by using the promo code ADXX-## replacing "##" with the approved discount number

      Important Note: to avoid delays, make sure to include the approved Deal Desk number in the Special Instructions box in step 3 of the ordering process
    • Rejected: the request lacked clarity, relevance, or failed to justify the discount in the broader context so the order will have to be placed again without the discount option

Note: To find/check your deal desks, go to Manage > Orders > Deal Desk button and use the search box to enter the deal desk number.

If you do not remember your deal desk number, leave the search box blank and scroll through the list to locate it.

For other GFI products, there is an option to submit an approved order directly. This feature is currently under development for Exinda, GFI ClearView and GFI FaxMaker Online orders.

articles.name: How do I submit/check a Deal Desk for a GFI Software product in the GFI Accounts Portal?
articles.title: How do I submit/check a Deal Desk for a GFI Software product in the GFI Accounts Portal?
articles.body:
Situation

There are special circumstances for an upcoming deal and you need to request a discount.

Resolution

Note: This feature is only available for certain Partner accounts and is submitted via the GFI Accounts Portal (not the GFI Partner Portal)

Exinda/GFI ClearView orders: refer to How do I submit a Deal Desk for Exinda or GFI ClearView in the Accounts Portal?

Quotes exceeding 2999 seats: enter the max amount of 2999 in step 3 and click Next. In step 4 modify the number in the QUANTITY column to the desired amount and click Preview Order.

  1. Log in to the Accounts Portal and follow the regular order process for your order
  2. Instead of completing the order in step 4, enter the requested discount amount in the Discount box and click Submit Deal Desk
    • Note: if you make changes in step 4 (for example, the quantity of one of the items), click the Preview Order button for the values to be updated and the Submit Deal Desk button will reappear.
    • Note: if you click any of the other buttons you will be met with the error "Discount can only be applied for Deal Desks". If you are trying to apply a preapproved promo code, please enter it in the  Promo Codes field instead.
  3. In the dialogue box that appears, provide a detailed but concise description of the circumstances or reasons for the discount being requested; before clicking Confirm check the guidelines below

    Enhancing Your Deal Desk Submission: To help expedite your Deal Desk submission and increase its chances of approval, make sure to address the below:

    • Clarity and Relevance: Are the reasons for the discount clearly explained and directly tied to the success of the deal?
    • Market and Competition: Does the request consider current market conditions or competitive factors that support the discount?
    • Customer Value: Is there a clear explanation of the value the deal offers to the customer and to GFI Software?
    • Strategic Fit: Does the reasoning align with GFI Software's strategic goals and provide a demonstrable effort by the partner to contribute to the discount?
    • Risk and Mitigation: Are potential risks addressed, and are there strategies to mitigate them?
  4. On the confirmation dialogue that appears click the Go to Deal Desk button to open the detailed Deal Desk page

    • Note: the confirmation dialogue includes the unique deal desk number starting with "DD-202"

    • Note: the Place Another Deal Desk button can be used to immediately submit another request (all submitted deal desks can be found by following the instructions in the note at the end of this article)
  5. On the page that opens you will see the details of your request and the status of your request; initially, this will be yellow, pending approval:
  6. Based on the overall strength of the submission, you will receive a notification that the deal desk has either been:
    • Approved: the request was well-supported, aligns with strategic goals, and makes a strong case so the discounted order can now be placed using the Place Order button
    • Rejected: the request lacked clarity, relevance, or failed to justify the discount in the broader context so the order will have to be placed again without the discount option

Note: To find/check your deal desks, go to Manage > Orders > Deal Desk button and use the search box to enter the deal desk number.

If you do not remember your deal desk number, leave the search box blank and scroll through the list to locate it.

articles.name: How do I place an order for GFI FaxMaker Online (FMO) or GFI FaxMaker - EtherFax?
articles.title: How do I place an order for GFI FaxMaker Online (FMO) or GFI FaxMaker - EtherFax?
articles.body:
Situation

You need to place an order for new business or for the renewal of GFI FaxMaker - EtherFax or GFI FaxMaker Online (FMO).

Disambiguation: These products are not to be confused with GFI FaxMaker. To place an order for GFI FaxMaker (i.e. not GFI FaxMaker Online or EtherFax), please follow the instructions in How do I place an order for a GFI Software product (new business, renewal or addon)?.

Important Note: All orders (including new subscriptions, renewals, upgrades, and add-ons) are placed by Distributors only, using the GFI Web Shop.

If you are a Reseller, please place your order with a Distributor in your area.

If you are an End user, please place your order with a Reseller in your area.

 

Step 1: Update or Create

  1. Log in to the GFI Accounts Portal (or if you are already logged in, click here: GFI Web Shop)
  2. Click on the Webshop button to go to step 1 of the 4-step order process
  3. Click on Create a new subscription (even if you are ordering a renewal, GFI FMO/EtherFax orders always create a new subscription)

 

Step 2: Customer Tier

  1. Use the Find an enduser and Find a reseller fields to search for the relevant accounts using either their email , their email domain preceded by an "@" (e.g. @gfi.com) or their Customer ID (CID) if you know it
  2. Once you have found the relevant account, click on it to set the selection, and click Next
    Note: if you select the wrong account by mistake, click the x in the top right corner of the incorrect account to clear the selection and search again

If you cannot find an account
1. It does not exist: follow the instructions in How do I create a Reseller account? (Distributors only) or How do I create an Enduser Account?
2. It is not visible to you: if you are certain the account exists but you cannot see it, submit a visibility request to our Customer Care team.

 

Step 3: Configure

  1.  Under Term Length select 1 Year
  2. Enable the switch for GFI FaxMaker Online Account as needed
    • For new account, enable the switch for GFI FaxMaker Online Trial Account.
    • For renewal of existing account, enable the switch for GFI FaxMaker Online Active Account.
  3. Enable the switch for Bundles -  Fax Pages as needed by the customer.

  4. Enter the number of Outbound Only Users the customer currently has in their account.
  5. Enter the number of Additional Fax Numbers the customer currently has in their account according to the specified Zone. Follow the instructions in How can I see GFI FaxMaker Online (FMO) subscription details in the GFI Accounts Portal? to view the count of Outbound Only Users and Additional Fax Numbers in the customer account.
  6. Enable the switch for Number Porting if required.
  7. Click Next

Step 4: Preview

  1. The preview page will display:
    • All the order data set from the previous steps
    • Itemised pricing information
    • The total order value
  2. Edit the quantities in the QUANTITY column as needed
  3. Enter proration in MONTH PRORATION column in front of Outbound Only Users and Additional Fax Numbers if needed.

  4. Once you have confirmed that everything is as expected, click the blue Order button (bottom right)
  5. In the pop-up, enter your purchase order number in the PO Number field and click Confirm
  6. Once the order has been successfully submitted you will see the following pop-up message

Note: Unlike orders for other GFI products, GFI FaxMaker Online (FMO) and GFI FaxMaker - EtherFax orders will not be visible in the Accounts Portal. You will receive email notifications concerning the progress of your order.

articles.name: How do I provision a new tenant for GFI LanGuard WAN for an existing user? [Internal]
articles.title: How do I provision a new tenant for GFI LanGuard WAN for an existing user? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You have received a request from an existing GFI LanGuard user requesting WAN tenant access.

Resolution

Note: New GFI LanGuard purchases include WAN access by default. For existing deployments, the customer has to request tenant access.

Prerequisites
- NET 6.0 (or later version)
- AWS CLI
- Provisioning package (extract to folder on your local machine)
- AWS credentials to deploy tenants for LanGuard (ping anuj.kumar@devfactory.com on Google Chat to ask for them)

When a new tenant needs to be provisioned, you will need to generate the necessary AWS IoT assets that the customer will use while activating WAN capability, including policies, templates, and things.

Automated Process

If you are on Microsoft Windows you can follow this process to have everything done automatically.

Important note: for the automated process to work, the provisioning package will have to be extracted to folder %USERPROFILE%\tenant

First-time set-up

This only needs to be done once:

  1. Run aws configure and set:
    • AWS Access Key ID: as provided by Anuj
    • AWS Secret Access Key: as provided by Anuj
    • Default region name: eu-west-1
    • Default output format: json
  2. Navigate to %USERPROFILE%\tenant and run dotnet nuget add source --name nuget.org https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json

The tenant_run script

Once the above is done, download the tenant_run.ps1 script (attached to this KBA) to your %USERPROFILE% folder and run it in PS. The script will:

  • Ask for the Zendesk ticket number and confirmation
  • Ask for the customer's first name (for the reply)
  • Ask for the company name and confirm the tenant ID prefix based on that
  • Run the script to create the keys and certs
  • Validate the attribute searchability and certificate as active
  • Confirm and then attach the keys and certificates to the Zendesk ticket
  • Send the response to the customer providing the Certificate ID, Tenant ID, LanGuard server WAN name and other important info
  • Tag the ticketlg_wan_provided
  • Solve the ticket
  • Move the created files from %USERPROFILE%\tenant\output to %USERPROFILE%\tenant\output\Sent\<tenantID>

 

Manual Process

1. Provisioning Process

For the first-time set-up:

  1. Run aws configure and set:
    • AWS Access Key ID: as provided by Anuj
    • AWS Secret Access Key: as provided by Anuj
    • Default region name: eu-west-1
    • Default output format: json
  2. Navigate to the root folder where you extracted the provisioning package and run dotnet nuget add source --name nuget.org https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json

To start the provisioning process

  1. Make up a tenantID:
    • 15 alphanumeric characters
    • the first 5 characters should be the first 5 characters of the customer's company name in ALL CAPS excluding all special characters and spaces (in the example below we are looking at customer DBK-Group)
    • the remaining 10 characters should be random lowercase alphanumeric characters
    • the resulting tenantID should be unique to the customer
  2. Navigate to the root folder where you extracted the provisioning package and run dotnet run .\TenantProvision.cs <tenantID>
    Note: If you get an error like “There are no versions available for the package”, run dotnet nuget add source --name nuget.org https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json again and retry
  3. Successful deployment will give you a summary output with all the values that the tenant needs to fill in the WAN Settings menu of the server’s UI. Copy the:
    • Certificate ID: 64 alphanumeric 
    • Tenant ID: the <tenantID> you created earlier
    • LanGuard server WAN name: <tenantID>-8 alphanumeric-4 alphanumeric-4 alphanumeric-4 alphanumeric-12 alphanumeric
  4. The generated certificates will be located in the output subfolder of your local provisioning package extraction folder. Copy the:
    • Provisioning claim certificate (output/<tenantID>_cert.pem)
    • Private Key for certificate (output/<tenantID>_private_key.pem)
    • LanGuard server certificate (output/<serverWANname>_cert.pem)
    • LanGuard server private key (output/<serverWANname>_private_key.pem)

Note for changes to existing tenants: if for some reason you need to provide an existing tenant with a new server, thing, and certificates, you can run dotnet run .\TenantProvision.cs <tenantID> --nonewtenant to generate only the server assets, keeping the existing configuration and provisioning the tenant's claim certificates.

 

2. Verification Process

For the first time set up your IAM user:

  1. Run aws sts get-caller-identity
    • The Account value is your 12-digit Account ID
    • From the Arn value, the part after "user/" is your IAM user name
  2. To set your password, run aws iam create-login-profile --user-name 'your_iam_ueser_name' --password 'your_chosen_password'

To verify the server IoT thing was correctly created after your IAM user account is set up:

  1. Go to the AWS IoT console
  2. Enter your Account ID, IAM user name, and Password (from Setting Up Your IAM User)
  3. The above link should take you directly to the eu-west-1 region Manage > All devices > Things
  4. Click on the deployed thing to verify its details; it must have the following searchable attributes:

    and the certificate associated and active:

 

3. Updating the Requester

After verifying, send the requester the following you copied from steps 4 and 5 of the Provisioning Process:

  • The files:
    • Provisioning claim certificate (output/<tenantID>_cert.pem)
    • Private Key for certificate (output/<tenantID>_private_key.pem)
    • LanGuard server certificate (output/<serverWANname>_cert.pem)
    • LanGuard server private key (output/<serverWANname>_private_key.pem)
  • Certificate ID
  • Tenant ID
  • LanGuard server WAN name

 

More Details...
The following artifacts are created with the successful deployment of a new tenant:
- A new, tenant-specific, provisioning template: This is used, in conjunction with the existing IoT policies and certificates, to allow new WAN agents to use temporary authorization to retrieve a permanent certificate to interact with AWS. In other words, it allows for the creation of the corresponding agent IoT thing every time a new WAN agent is installed anywhere.
- Provisioning claim certificates: The certificate + associated private key + certificate ID to achieve the aforementioned action. This pair is tenant-specific and is intended to be used by all the new WAN agents of the same tenant.
- A server IoT thing, along with the corresponding certificate and private key: The server thing is another type of IoT thing, with some elevated privileges (e.g. it can create IoT jobs to issue scan/patch orders).

articles.name: How do I find a Partner's renewal discount percentage (partner discount/PD/channel margin)? [Internal]
articles.title: How do I find a Partner's renewal discount percentage (partner discount/PD/channel margin)? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You are in the Accounts Portal and need to find a partner's renewal discount percentage (also referred to as partner discount, PD or channel margin).

Resolution

  1. Go to Manage > Accounts and search using the relevant company name/domain name (remember to include the "@")/CID
  2. Locate the relevant account in the results and click on their company name
  3. On the sliding overlay window look under Discount Info to locate their Channel Margin percentage

articles.name: How do I find a Zuora ID? [Internal]
articles.title: How do I find a Zuora ID? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You are in the Accounts Portal and need to find a customer or partner's Zuora ID.

Resolution

  1. Go to Manage > Accounts and search using the relevant company name/domain name (remember to include the "@")/CID
  2. Locate the relevant account in the results and click on their company name
  3. On the sliding overlay window scroll down Advanced Information to locate the Zuora ID (usually the "Zuora Id (USD)" is the one you need)

articles.name: How can I place a new business order for an EOL product/irregular term? [Internal]
articles.title: How can I place a new business order for an EOL product/irregular term? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You have received a pre-approved order for a new subscription for an EOL product (e.g. Kerio Operator) or an irregular term (e.g. 17 months).

Important Note: new business orders for EOL products/irregular terms must never be processed without approval. If the order is coming directly from a Distributor without the relevant approval it should be immediately rejected.

 

Resolution

As this is for an EOL product/irregular term the order cannot be placed through the Web Shop. It must be done in Zuora so the subscription syncs to the Accounts Portal and creates the relevant license in the correct way.

  1. Log in to Zuora and from the left menu select Subscriptions > Add New Subscription button
  2. Fill in the following fields:
    • Customer Name + Invoice Owner (use the Search button to find the correct one using their Zuora ID)
    • Check the Invoice The Subscription Separately box
    • Enduser + Distributor + Reseller with their Accounts Portal IDs (CIDs)
    • PO Number (as provided by the Distributor on their PO)
    • For an irregular term edit the Initial Term to match the preapproved term in Months

      Note: the Renewal Term should not be edited as that would result in the same irregular term being applied during all subsequent renewals
  3. Scroll down and under Product & Charges select the Product and Rate Plan. Enter the Distributor's Partner renewal discount, the desired seat Quantity > Save And Preview
  4. In the preview, set the dates (usually today's date like a regular new business order), select End of Term click Refresh and check the value matches the PO. Then click Done to return to the draft subscription page.

    Note: if the values do not match, there is either a mistake in the manual input on the subscription draft page or the submitted PO is incorrect
  5. Click Activate, enter the Contract Effective date (usually today's date like a regular new business order) > Save
    • Note: if this is for an irregular term and it is not new business, the Contract Effective date will be the last expiry date, e.g. if the product for 17 months renewal expires 2024-10-19, then that would be the Contract Effective date (regardless of today's date)
    • Exception: sometimes irregular term renewals are approved for co-terming; in this case, a specific expiry date may be targetted so the contract effective date would have to match, e.g. if the product for 17 months renewal expires 2024-10-19 but the co-term date needed is 2026-03-24, the Contract Effective date would be 2024-10-24 (i.e. 2024-10-24 + 17 months = 2026-03-24)
  6. The page will go blank. Refresh it to reveal the subscription and click the Create Bill Run button
  7. On the Create Bill Run page copy the Next Renewal Date into the Target Date, then UNCHECK the Usage box (this is VERY IMPORTANT) and only after unchecking the Usage box, click Create Bill Run > Yes
  8. On the Bill Run page that opens click the invoice link
  9. On the invoice page click View Invoice PDF to download and check the invoice. After checking it click Post Invoice
    and once the invoice has been posted the Post Invoice button will change to Email Invoice. Click it to email it to the default invoice (as would happen in a regular order).
  10. Log in to the Accounts Portal > Manage > Subscriptions, in the search box enter the subscription number from Zuora (step 6) > ellipses > View Details and on the page that opens click the Generate link under the relevant product to create the license.
  11. Inform the Distributor that the order has been processed and provide them with the invoice and subscription number.
